newsitem.title: USA: U.S. to announce N. Korea food aid next week.
newsitem.headline: U.S. to announce N. Korea food aid next week.

text.p: The United States expects to announce new food aid for North Korea next week, the State Department said on Thursday.

"As for food aid, we are now working with several agencies of our government to develop our response to the WFP (World Food Program) food appeal. I would expect by next week we would have an answer," spokesman Nicholas Burns told reporters.
The World Food Program, a U.N. agency, has called for $95.5 million in food aid to help meet North Korea's food shortages, which have worsened because of two years of flooding.
Since the fall of 1995, the United States has provided $18.4 million in assistance to the Stalinist Pyongyang regime.

The United States and other countries have shown increased willingness recently to respond to North Korean appeals amid signs that Pyongyang may agree to enter into landmark peace talks involving the United States, rival South Korea and China.
The aim of the negotiations is to defuse tensions on the Korean peninsula and finally close the books on the 1950-53 Korean War with a peace treaty.
